article.headline: Hawaii 54, Long Beach State 45
article.story: HONOLULU (AP) -- Matt Gibson scored 15 points as Hawaii held off Long Beach State to remain undefeated with a 54-45 win Monday night in the first round of the Rainbow Classic. After the Rainbow Warriors scored the first eight points of the second half, Long Beach State rallied with a 20-4 run over a 10-minute period to close an 18-point deficit to 38-36 with 7:14 remaining on a 3-pointer by Kevin Houston. Hawaii's Vaidotas Peciukas then hit two free throws to start a 7-0 run. The 49ers closed to 50-45 on two free throws by Jibril Hodges, but then missed on a 3-point attempt by Chris Jenkins with 1:02 left and failed to convert twice with less than a minute to go. Jeff Blackett added 12 points and 10 rebounds for the Rainbow Warriors (6-0). Long Beach State (1-6) was led by Shawn Hawkins' 10 points as the 49ers dropped their fourth straight game. Hawaii finished the game shooting just 28 percent (18-of-61) from the field, while the 49ers shot 30 percent (18-of-59). Hawaii scored 12 points off 14 Long Beach State turnovers in the first half and went on a 7-2 run over the final four minutes of the half to lead 26-16 at halftime.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
